snippet: When Miami and Miami-Dade County officials agreed to foot most of the bill for the Marlins’ new stadium, it was understood the team would commit to being competitive, which is not the case after Tuesday’s trade.
abstract: Miami and Miami-Dade County officials provided most of funding to build new stadium for Miami Marlins with understanding that team would commit financially to fielding a competitive team, bargain that has so far gone unfulfilled; Marlins trade with Toronto Blue Jays, which is not yet official, leaves their roster depleted and their payroll relatively small.
lead_paragraph: When Miami and Miami-Dade County officials agreed to foot most of the bill for the Marlins’ new stadium, it was understood the team would commit to being competitive, which is not the case after Tuesday’s trade.
